intro: Malache leptocarpa, commonly known as the slender-leaved malache, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or undergrowth. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
